page.title: 01THE RATBY AND GROBY AREA.
page.content: The area lies approximately 5 miles WNW of Leicester.It is traversed by two major,busy roads,the M1 which sweeps diagonally SE-NW and the A50 which cuts across the NE corner parallel to the M1.The landscape in the eastern half is hilly due to the underlying granite,whereas the western half is more undulating due to the Keuper Marl. Small parts of two expanding villages,Ratby and Groby are included in the area and between them is the 254 acre Martinshaw Wood a favourite haunt for naturalists and walkers. Groby was once an important centre for granite quarrying but this has now declined and now there are no working quarries within the area of study.
